result.execSummary:
The defendant Nickolas M Weihert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED TO COSTS. PAID IN FULL.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Not to possess any drugs without a valid prescription.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
No alcohol/drugs.
Not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

Case 14CM654 was dismissed and read into: 14CF405 and 13CT1723.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC  
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Defendant Nickolas M Weihert in court, in custody, with attorney Richard D Martin.   Mary C Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.


Court orders the following: 
- 9 months jail consecutive straight time STAYED for 2 years Probation
- Court costs of $268.00 - APPLY BAIL FROM 13CT1723
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 - APPLY BAIL FROM 13CT1723
- Conditions of Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol/drugs.  Submit to a formal AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Not possess any drugs without a prescription. Not drive without a license.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Nickolas M Weihert in court, in custody, with attorney Richard D Martin.   Timothy F Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on May 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Per Atty Martin, Hearing was to be with Comm Pieper, not Br 9.

Defendant Nickolas M Weihert in court, in custody, with attorney Richard D Martin.   Brian J Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Martin requests this matter be put over to Monday, May 12, 2014 @ 10:00 a.m. for a preliminary waiver, since he was unable to see his client. State has no objection. Court grants adjournment.   Preliminary  Hearing time limits tolled. Defendant advised court that he was previously fingerprinted for this matter. Court orders the Sheriff's Department to fingerprint this defendant and file with the court, unless previously done, then those fingerprints are to be filed with the court.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 9, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Nickolas M Weihert in court, in custody, with attorney Katie Bricco for  Richard D Martin.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Nickolas M Weihert
Current: 515 West Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 04-15-2014)
Prior: 1609 Country Club Lane, Watertown, WI 53098

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with any witnesses listed in the complaint.

Defendant Nickolas M Weihert in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel. Bail can be review at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
